refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: ubxtool is a tool for u-blox GPS. If you do not have a u-blox GPS then can stop reading now.

This tool operates with your u-blox GPS at a very low level. To understand ubxtool you must first be familiar with your u-blox GPS and the documentation for the u-blox binary protocol. The u-blox protocol varies greatly depending on GPS model and firmware revision.

ubxtool can decode common u-blox binary messages, poll the GPS status, enable and disable GPS features, and send user generated commands to the GPS. It can read binary messages from a file. It can read and write directly through a serial device, or through a running gpsd instance.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The program accepts the following options:

listitem.para: Send a command to the GPS. Accepts one parameter, COMMAND, a comma-separated list of hexadecimal bytes specifying the class, the ID, and any needed payload. The header, length, and checksum are added automatically.
Disable an option in the GPS. Accepts one parameter, OPTION, the option to disable.
Disable use of the BeiDou (COMPASS) constellation.
Disable sending of the basic binary messages.
Disable sending of ECEF binary messages.
Disable use of the GALILEO constellation.
Disable use of the GLONASS constellation.
Disable use of the GPS and QZSS constellations.
Disable sending basic NMEA messages. The messages are GBS, GGA, GSA, GGL, GST, GSV, RMC, VTG, and ZDA.
Disable sending of the UBX-RXM-RAWX messages.
Disable use of the SBAS constellation.
Disable sending TMODE2.
Disable sending UBX-TIM-TP.
Enable an option in the GPS. Accepts one parameter, OPTION, the option to enable. -e accepts the same OPTIONs as -d, except the action is to enable the option.

Connect to a file or device. Accepts one parameter, FILE, the file or device to open. Files are opened read-only. Character devices are opened read/write, unless the -r parameter is given. Requires the pyserial module.
Makes ubxtool print a usage message and exit.
Specifies interface (port) for port-related commands.
Sets optional mode parameter to a -p PRESET command.
Sets the protocol version to use for sending commands. Minimum 10 (ublox 5). Maximum 27 (u-blox 9)
Send a preset command the GPS. Accepts one parameter, PRESET, the name of the command to send. ubxtool will exit after the GPS acknowledges the command, unless the -W is given.
Poll the antenna configuration (UBX-CFG-ANT).
Coldboot the GPS (UBX-CFG-RST).
Poll the enabled constellations (UBX-CFG-GNSS).
Hotboot the GPS (UBX-CFG-RST).
Configure the Dynamic Platform Model. (UBX-CFG-NAV5).
Poll the Nav Engines Settings (UBX-CFG-NAV5).
Poll the Nav Engines Expert Settings (UBX-CFG-NAVX5).
Poll power management settings (UBX-CFG-PMS).
Poll I/O port settings (UBX-CFG-PRT).
Reset config to defaults (UBX-CFG-CFG).
Poll UBX-RXM-RAWX message.
Reset configuration to defaults (UBX-CFG-CFG).
Save current configuration (UBX-CFG-CFG).
Poll SBAS settings (UBX-CFG-SBAS).
Poll survey in data (UBX-CFG-SVIN).
Poll Time Mode 2 configuration (UBX-CFG-TMODE2).
Poll time pulse timedata (UBX-TIM-TP).
Get Time Pulse decodes (UBX-TIM-TP5).
Poll USB config (UBX-CFG-USB).
Poll GPS version (UBX-MON-VER).
Warmboot the GPS (UBX-CFG-RST).
Save all raw data from the GPS into the file RAW.
Read only. Do not send anything to the GPS.
Set the GPS serial port speed to SPEED bps.
Set local serial port speed to SPEED bps. Default 115,200 bps.
Print ubxtool version and exit.
Set verbosity level to VERBOSITY. Verbosity can be from 0 (very quiet), 2 (decode messages), to 4 (very noisy). Default 1.
Wait for WAIT seconds before exiting. Will exit early on command completion of -d, -e or -p command, unless -W is given. Default 2.0 second.
Makes ubxtool print a usage message and exit.

By default, ubxtool collects data from all compatible devices on localhost, using the default GPSD port 2947. An optional argument may specify a server to get data from. A colon-separated suffix is taken as a port number. If there is a second colon-separated suffix, that is taken as a specific device name to be watched. Further details on the
gps 1 man page.

refsect1.title: ENVIRONMENT
refsect1.para: Options can be placed in the UBXOPTS environment variable. UBXOPTS is processed before the CLI options.

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.para:
Decode raw log file:
ubxtool -r -f ublox-neo-m8n.log

Change GPS port speed of device on /dev/ttyAMA0 to 230,400 bps:
ubxtool -S 230400 -f /dev/ttyAMA0

Watch entire GPS reset cycle, include $GPTXT messages:
ubxtool -p COLDBOOT -w 20 -v 2

Poll Enabled Constellations:
ubxtool -p GNSS
Dump gpsd data from remote server:
ubxtool -w 5 server

refsect1.title: SEE ALSO
refsect1.para: ubxtool is written to conform to the official u-blox documentation for the u-blox binary protocol.

gpsd 8 ,
gps 1 ,
cgps 1 ,
xgps 1 ,
gpsfake 1 ,
gpsctl 1 ,
gpscat 1 ,
gnuplot 1 .
